benchmark_details.name: Moral Turing Test: Evaluating Human-LLM Alignment in Moral Decision-Making
benchmark_details.overview: The study investigates human alignment with large language model (LLM) moral judgments through a corpus of human- and LLM-generated responses to various moral scenarios, highlighting misalignment and human preferences in moral decision-making.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To examine the alignment between human moral judgments and those of LLMs, particularly focusing on detection and agreement in moral decision-making.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Findings may be model-specific, particularly to the GPT-3.5 architecture.

data.source: Responses generated through structured moral scenarios presented to human participants and LLM (GPT-3.5) models.
data.annotation: Responses were manually collected from human participants and generated by LLMs.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated through evaluation of participant responses to judgment detection and agreement.
methodology.interpretation: Higher agreement rates indicated stronger alignment and preference for LLM-generated judgments in morally complex scenarios.
methodology.baseline_results: Models achieved detection accuracy of approximately 64% on corpus 1 and 71% on corpus 2.
methodology.validation: Statistical tests including t-tests and ANOVAs were conducted to validate findings.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Demographic breakdown of participants was collected, revealing no significant differences in results based on gender.
targeted_risks.harm: Potential risk of misalignment in moral decision-making leading to harmful outcomes.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Informed consent was obtained from all participants before the experiments.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants received clear instructions regarding their involvement and data usage.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Research was conducted in accordance with the Declaration of Helsinki.
